title: Sticky Spareribs with Chinkiang Vinegar
source: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
categories: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
ingredients: - 1 1/2 pounds pork riblets, trimmed and cut between bones into individual ribs
- 1 (2-inch) piece ginger, sliced into thin rounds
directions: 1. Bring ribs and 2 quarts cold water to a boil in a 14-inch flat-bottomed wok or large Dutch oven over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer gently for 5 minutes.
2. Drain ribs, rinse well, and pat dry with paper towels.
3. Heat the empty wok over high heat until just smoking. Reduce heat to medium-high, drizzle vegetable oil around the perimeter, and heat until just smoking again.
4. Add rock sugar and cook, stirring constantly, until melted and amber-colored, about 1 minute.
5. Add ginger and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 15 to 30 seconds.
6. Stir in ribs, 1/2 cup water, vinegar, Shaoxing wine, dark soy sauce, and bouillon powder (if using). Bring to a boil.
7. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until ribs are just tender with a slight chew, 15 to 20 minutes.
8. Uncover, increase heat to high, and vigorously simmer, stirring frequently, until sauce thickens and coats the ribs, 5 to 7 minutes.
9. Stir in sesame oil and white pepper. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve.
